alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:15PM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Additional new snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Cherry, Hooker, Thomas, Logan and Western Cherry Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening to 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; Thomas; Western Cherry
